reviewText:
excellent historic documentary of the events of Wounded Knee of 1973.  Must buy and see.  Charles Abourezk
did an excellent job on this production.

I actually lead discussions and show this doc film as I am pictured in it 3X.  All proceeds I take in are sent to International Leonard Peltier D
defense Committee in Fargo.  I am available in SF Bay Area and NE MN/NW WI areas  (Duluth-
superoir
It is a great learning opportunity.

This movie was filmed on the 30th Anniversary of the confrontation between the United States Government and its supporters on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation, and a coalition of traditional Indians and members of the American Indian Movement. The 71 day Seige resulted in two Indians being killed, seven people wounded, and years of federal prosecutions of those inside. One US Marshall was wounded. It is a powerfully emotional documentary intended to show how this moment in American Indian history transformed those who were involved, and led them to serve Indian tribes and tribal peoples all around the United States. It is a compelling movie. Highly recommended. A Tattoo On My Heart: The Warriors of Wounded Knee 1973
